DESCRI

decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason: This is required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

No demolition or development shall take place until a stage 1 written scheme of investigation (WSI) has been submitted to and approved by the local planning authority in writing. For land that is included within the WSI, no demolition or development shall take place other than in accordance with the agreed WSI, and the programme and methodology of site evaluation and thenomination of a competent person(s) or organisation to undertake the agreed works. If heritage assets of archaeological interest are identified by stage 1 then for those parts of the site which have archaeological interest a stage 2 WSI shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority in writing. For land that is included within the stage 2 WSI, no demolition/development shall take place other than in accordance with the agreed stage 2 WSI which shall include:A. The statement of significance and research objectives, the programme and methodology of site investigation and recording and the nomination of a competent person(s) or organisation to undertake the agreed works B. The programme for post-investigation assessment and subsequent analysis, publication & dissemination and deposition of resulting material. This part of the condition shall not be discharged until these elements have been fulfilled in accordance with the programme set out in the stage 2 WSI.Reason: To avoid harm to and record assets of archaeological significance in accordance with policy HC1 of the London Plan 2021and Policy DM12 of the LDF Core Adopted April 2012.

The development shall be carried out in accordance with the Construction Traffic Management Plan, prepared by RGP (Amended August 2021).Reason: In order to safeguard the amenities of the surrounding residential occupiers and in the interests of the safety and operation of the highway network, in accordance with policies T4 and T7 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS7 and DM9 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012

The site and building works required to implement the development shall be only carried out between the hours of 08.00 and 18.00 Mondays to Fridays and between 08.00 and 13.00 on Saturdays and not at all on Bank Holidays and Sundays. Reason: To ensure satisfactory living conditions for neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

In the event at any time when carrying out the approved development that contamination is found that was not previously identified, it must be reported in writing immediately to the Local Planning Authority. An investigation and risk assessment must be undertaken in respect of this contamination and where remediation is necessary a remediation scheme must be prepared andimplemented upon approval of the Local Planning Authority.Reason: To ensure that risks from land contamination are minimised, in accordance with policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The works shall be carried out in accordance with the Arboricultural Impact Assessment and Method Statement, prepared by Arbeco dated 19/08/21.Reason: To safeguard trees worthy of retention and in the interests of the character and appearance of the area, in accordance with policy G7 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Notwithstanding the conclusions reached within the Preliminary Ecology Appraisal, following the commencement of development, should any presence or otherwise of Stag Beetles not previously identified be found, works must stop immediately and the local planning authority informed. Should this eventuality occur then advice shall be sought from a qualified ecologist on how to proceed, and no further development shall be carried out until details of a scheme of mitigation or enhancement works that minimises the adverse effects of the development on the protected species has been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.Reason: In order to prevent any harm to protected and priority species in accordance with the Wildlife and Countryside Act, 1981 (as amended), National Planning Policy Framework (2019) and Policy G6 of the London Plan and Policy DM6 of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The development hereby permitted shall comply with the submitted Site Waste Management Plan, prepared by Temple dated 27/04/2021.Reason: To ensure the development promotes the circular economy outcomes and supports the London Plan aim for net-zero waste in accordance with Policy SI 7 of the London Plan (2021).

The works shall comply with the recommendations set out in paragraphs 5.5-5.16 of Preliminary Bat Roost Assessment dated 03/06/2021.Reason: In order to prevent any harm to bats in accordance with the Wildlife and Countryside Act, 1981 (as amended), National Planning Policy Framework (2019) and Policy DM6 of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Following demolition the site shall be secured and screened in accordance with details that shall have been submitted to and approved within 4 weeks from the commencement of the development on site.Reason: To safeguard the visual amenity of the site and mitigate the impact of the proposal on the setting of various heritage assets in accordance with policies DM10, DM12 LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012 and London Plan Policy HC1.

The development to which this permission relates shall not be commenced until a scheme to enhance the nature conservation interest of the site and an associated program for implementation and management of the scheme, has been submitted to and agreed in writing by the local planning authority. The approved scheme shall be implemented in accordance with the approvedprogramme.Reason: To safeguard the biodiversity and nature conservation value of the site, in accordance with policy G4 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS3 and DM6 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The works shall be carried out in accordance with the Demolition Management Plan dated 27/04/2021. Any conflicts between the Demolition Management Plan and condition 9 (compliance with Site Waste Management Plan) shall be resolved in favour of this condition.Reason: In order to safeguard the amenities of the surrounding residential occupiers and in the interests of the safety and operation of the highway network, in accordance with policies T4 and T7 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS7 and DM9 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Up to three trees being T1, T2, and T10 are permitted to be removed to facilitate the development hereby approved in accordance with 21/03718/TCA. Prior to the removal of any tree a notification identifying the tree to be removed shall have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.Reason: To safeguard trees worthy of retention and in the interests of the character and appearance of the area, in accordance with policies G7 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Subject to the number of trees removed (see condition14), a tree replacement strategy shall have been submitted to and approved by the LPA within 3 months of the removal of any tree. The strategy shall propose two replacement trees for every tree removed (or proposed to be removed) including the size, species and location to be agreed with the LPA.Reason: To safeguard trees worthy of retention and in the interests of the character and appearance of the area, in accordance with policies G7 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Within 12 months of commencement, a landscaping plan shall have been submitted to and approved by the LPA. The landscaping plan shall be implemented in accordance with the approved landscaping scheme within the first planting season following completion of the works.Reason: To safeguard trees worthy of retention and in the interests of the character and appearance of the area, in accordance with policies G7 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The development to which this permission relates shall be carried out in strict accordance with the recommendations contained within the Kingfisher Leisure Centre - Preliminary Ecological Appraisal 09/06/21.Reason: To safeguard the biodiversity and nature conservation value of the site, in accordance with policy G6 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS3 and DM6 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.
description: Demolition of the former Kingfisher Leisure Centre building
